newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico electricity commission sets $250 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: Mexico electricity commission sets $250 mln loan.

text.p: Mexico's Federal Electricity Commission said on Wednesday that it had agreed on a syndicated loan worth $250 million.
The five-year variable rate loan will pay an average of LIBOR plus 200 basis points, it said in a statement, adding that the lead agents for the loan were Societe Generale and Citibank.
The funds from the loan will be used to finance investment and improve the company's debt profile, it said.
Co-leaders of the loan were Bank of Montreal, Bank of Tokyo, Mitsubishi of Japan, and Banco Santander Investment.

The commission said that 15 other banking institutions also took part in the loan, including banks from Korea and Taiwan that took place for the first time in a syndicated loan with a Mexican organisation.
The commission's director-general, Rogelio Gasca Neri, said that the loan was put together in a month and will be an important factor in covering its investments and 1996 obligations.
